title: Block pushed with constant force across a track

content.question:
Position <math alttext="(in meters)" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>(m)</mtext></math>

Time <math alttext="(in seconds)" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>(s)</mtext></math>

<math alttext="0.0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>0.0</mtext></math>
<math alttext="0.0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>0.0</mtext></math>

<math alttext="0.1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>0.1</mtext></math>
<math alttext="1.0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>1.0</mtext></math>

<math alttext="0.4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>0.4</mtext></math>
<math alttext="2.0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>2.0</mtext></math>

<math alttext="0.9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>0.9</mtext></math>
<math alttext="3.0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>3.0</mtext></math>

<math alttext="1.6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>1.6</mtext></math>
<math alttext="4.0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>4.0</mtext></math>

A block of mass <math alttext="2.0 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>2.0 kg</mtext></math>, starting from rest, is pushed with a constant force across a horizontal track. The position of the block as a function of time is recorded, and the data are shown in the table. What is the magnitude of the change in momentum of the block between zero and <math alttext="4.0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4.0</mn></math> seconds?

choices.label: <math alttext="0.8 kilogram meter per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>0.8 kg·m/s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="1.2 kilogram meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>1.2 kg·m/s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="1.6 kilogram meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>1.6 kg·m/s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="3.2 kilogram meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>3.2 kg·m/s</mtext></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="1.6 kilogram meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>1.6 kg·m/s</mtext></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
